revised_title: On the Solubility of Helium in Water and its Detection in the Atmosphere
tldr: The author investigates the solubility of helium in water and attempts to detect its presence in the atmosphere. The experiment involves dissolving a mixture of helium and argon in water and observing the changes in the residue. The results suggest that helium is present in the atmosphere in very small quantities, possibly less than a ten-thousandth part.
